greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A225546(A122111(n)).
comment: A225546 and A122111 are both self-inverse permutations of the positive integers based on prime factorizations, and they share further common properties. For instance, they map the prime numbers to powers of 2: A225546 maps the k-th prime to 2^2^(k-1), whereas A122111 maps it to 2^k.

In composing these permutations, this sequence maps the list of prime numbers to the squarefree numbers, as listed in A019565; and the "normal" numbers (A055932), as listed in A057335, to ascending powers of 2.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_ and _Peter Munn_, Jul 17 2020
